titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the John Davis Lodge papers, 1886-1987
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Grace Hawes and Katherine Reynolds

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-11-11T14:37-0800

change.item: Declassified records returned to collection and added to finding aid by Sarah Patton.
Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated.
Revised by Jill Golden to update encoding and add unitid.
Descriptions of sound recordings added and AV access statement updated.
Updated container list after rehousing for SAL3 transfer.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::John Davis Lodge Papers)//EN" "reg_025.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 288 manuscript boxes, 26 oversize boxes, 3 cubic foot boxes, 1 card file box, 3 album boxes, 121 envelopes, 2 sound cassettes, 1 sound tape reel, 1 sound disc

did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches and writings, dispatches, reports, memoranda, clippings, other printed matter, photographs, sound recordings, and motion picture film relating to the Republican Party, national and Connecticut politics, and American foreign relations, especially with Spain, Argentina and Switzerland.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 310-311 closed. The collection is stored off site; a minimum of two days notice is required for use. Boxes may be requested through Stanford's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu.

Use copies of some sound recordings in this collection are available for immediate access. To access other sound recordings, video recordings, or motion picture material, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], John Davis Lodge papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1986.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

eventgrp.event: Lawyer, American Economic Foundation, New York

chronitem.event: Special Presidential Ambassador, Panama, Costa Rica, Puerto Rico
Member of U.S. Delegation to the United Nations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, speeches and writings, dispatches, reports, memoranda, clippings, other printed matter, photographs, sound recordings, and motion picture film relating to the Republican Party, national and Connecticut politics, and American foreign relations, especially with Spain, Argentina and Switzerland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biographical material (including Lodge's education and family background), correspondence, and speeches and writings.

scopecontent.p: Includes Committee on Foreign Affairs memoranda ("Terms of Supplemental Appropriation for Relief Assistance to War Devastated Countries" and "Breaches of Contract and Good Faith by the United States Incident to and Since World War II") (1947); and a memorandum regarding, and drafts of, a resolution put forth by Lodge in the House of Representatives, referred by the Committee of Foreign Affairs, regarding Formosa (1950).

Sound recording of John Davis Lodge speech "Spanish-American Friendship" to the American Club of Southern Spain, sound cassette,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leading up to the United States Bicentennial, John Davis Lodge discusses the historical circumstances leading to the development of a Spanish-American friendship and how freedom and a renewed sense of country stands in opposition to Communist encroachment.

did.unittitle: Sound recording of John Davis Lodge's comments at the Conference for Moral Re-Armament, Switzerland, sound cassette,
Republican National Committee, "Go, Goldwater!," sound disc,

did.unittitle: 84 prints portraying John D. Lodge during his Governorship of Connecticut,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 1 print of Mr. and Mrs. Dwight Eisenhower; 1 print of the USS Coral Sea; 2 prints of the 1950 campaign; 7 prints of the 1954 campaign; 5 prints of Lodge's inauguration; 1 print of Mrs. Lodge and Richard Nixon; and 1 print each of Lodge with Governor John Volpe and Liberian Under-Secretary of State Momolu Dukuly.

did.unittitle: Portrayals of John D. Lodge during his Ambassadorship to Spain,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 71 prints of Mallorca, Junipero Serra's birthplace; 23 prints of Lodge and Spanish Foreign Minister Fernando Maria Castiella; 1 print of Mr. and Mrs. Lodge with Clare Boothe Luce; 1 print of Lodge and Richard Nixon; and 16 prints of Lodge and Foreign Minister Castiella signing the 1960 Agriculture Agreement between Spain and the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 92 prints of Lodge's visit to Arevalo, Spain; 5 prints of the European Chiefs of Mission Conference in Paris; 12 prints of the International Conference on Civil Service Training in Madrid; and 34 prints of Lodge attending an American Chamber of Commerce banquet in Barcelona.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 26 prints of Admiral George Anderson and Francisco Franco; 44 prints of the recommissioning of the Legazpi; and 28 prints of United States Press Secretary James Hagerty's visit to Madrid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 2 prints of President Eisenhower's visit to Spain, 1959; 2 prints of Major General S.J. Donovan, Major General H.K. Mooney and Lodge; 38 prints of the Lodge's tour of Spain, 1959; 37 prints of the recommissioning of the Princesa; and 17 prints of General Donovan and Lodge at San Javier.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 21 prints of the United States House members of the Subcommittee on Foreign Operations and Subcommittee on International Operations with Generalissimo Franco; 2 prints of Lodge with Maj. Gen. A. P. O'meara, Maj. Gen. S. J. Donovan and Brig. Gen. Royal Reynolds.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 2 prints of Lodge and Second Secretary Lyle Lane; 2 prints of the Henry Cabot Lodge, Sr. bronze; 45 prints of the Barcelona International Samples Fair, 1959; 1 print of Bob Wilson; and 7 prints of a 1959 press conference.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 36 prints of various receptions attended by the Lodges; 39 prints of John D., Francesca, Lily and Beatrice Lodge; and 11 prints of the Minister of Foreign Affairs Castiella, Secretary of State John Foster Dulles, Spanish Ambassador to the United States Jose Maria de Areilza, Count of Motrico and John D. Lodge.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also includes 69 prints of Ezra Taft Benson; 7 prints of Maj. Gen. August W. Kissner, Maj Gen. H.K. Mooney, Gen. Thomas S. Power, and John D. Lodge; and 28 prints of Secretary Neil McElroy's visit with Generalissimo Franco, Minister of Foreign Affairs Castiella, Minister of the Army Lt. Gen. Barroso and Lodge.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 11 prints of Lodge with Spanish Minister of Agriculture Don Cirilo Canovas; 1 print of Mrs. Lodge with Italian Ambassador Duquesa de Sueca; and 46 prints of Mrs. Lodge and Beatrice at the hospital of Asilo de San Rafael.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 1 print of Givon Parson, Robert Cavanaugh, Lodge, Gerald Warner, and Richard Courtenaye; 19 prints of the Elizondo Radar Site; 8 prints of Cardinal Francis Spellman; 45 prints of the USS McGowan; and 31 unidentified prints.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 4 prints of Lodge with Generalissimo Franco; 19 prints of Lodge's appointment to the Municipal Palace of Culture; 12 prints of Lodge with Prescott Bush; 7 prints of Lodge with the House of Representatives Committee on Operations; and 19 prints of Lodge's presentation of the Medal of Freedom to Madame Eugenie Duport.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 6 prints of Mr. and Mrs. Skelton; 7 prints of under-secretary Minister of the Presidency Luis Carrero Blanco, Foreign Minister Castiella and Lodge; and 9 prints of Lodge at the "El Carmen de los Martires,; Granada.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 1 print of Lodge with Minister and Deputy Chief of Mission, Homer Byington; 1 print of Lodge with Admiral Charles P. Brown, Commander of the U.S. Sixth Fleet; 12 prints of the Center for North American Studies in Valencia; and 24 prints of Senator Hubert Humphrey's visit to Madrid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 7 prints of Lodge with Count yof Mayalde, mayor of Madrid; 2 prints of Lodge awarding Antonio Ubarrechena the Medal of Freedom; 10 prints of the Center for North American Studies in Valencia; 1 print of Foreign Affairs Minister Castiella; 11 prints of Lodge at the School of Industrial Organization, and 1 print of Robert Michel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 13 prints of Lodge with Henry Cabot Lodge, Jr., Spanish Amb. to the U.N. Jose Felix de Lequerica, Spanish Minister of Foreign Affairs Alberto Martin Artajo and Minister of Commerce Manuel Arburua; 6 prints of Lionel Hampton in Madrid; 1 print of the USS Forrestal; and 24 prints of the Citizens Advisory Committee's inspection of air bases.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 2 prints of Commandante Benito receiving the Legion of Merit Award; 3 prints of Beatrice Lodge; 4 prints of Admiral Crommelin, Admiral Fernandez de Bobadilla, and Lodge; 6 prints of Lodge and Minister of Foreign Affairs Artajo; and 27 prints of the Barcelona International Samples Fair, 1956.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 2 prints of Lt. Gen. Eduardo Gouyaley receiving the Legion of Merit Award; 11 prints of the Barcelona International Samples Fair, 1956; 1 print of Lodge with Jose Luis de la Pena of Diario Informaciones; 7 prints of Lodge with Foreign Minister Artajo; 1 print of Count Godo; and 16 prints of Beatrice as Queen of the Fiesta de la Vendimia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 5 prints of Minister of Foreign Affairs Alberto Artajo, Sec. of State John F. Dulles, Lodge and Generalissimo Franco; 3 prints of Lodge and Spanish Red Cross Pres. Martinez de Tena; 58 prints of Lodge at Zaragoya; and 2 prints of Mrs. Lodge with Generalissimo Franco and his wife.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 2 prints of the Joint Committee on Atomic Energy with Gen. Kissner and Senators Bricker and Anderson; 15 prints of the Lodge's Presentation of Credentials; 14 prints of Sec. Neil McElroy's visit to Madrid; and 1 print of Pope John XXIII with Mr. and Mrs. Lodge and Beatrice.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 29 prints of Lodge and Sec. of the Navy Thomas S. Gates; 12 prints of Admiral Arleigh A. Burke and Lodge; 27 prints of Sec. of Air James H. Douglas; 7 prints of the Director General of Instruction in the Ministry of Air Gen. Jose Aviles Bascuas receiving the Legion of Merit Award.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 11 prints of Minister of Army Antonio Barroso and President of the Cortes Esteban Bilbao; 2 prints of Lodge, Vice-Adm. E.C Ekstrom, Capt. Hale, and Capt. Collett; 15 prints of Minister of Foreign Affairs Castiella and John S. Burgess, Agricultural Attache; and 16 prints of Deputy Sec. of Defense Donald Quarles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 5 prints of Jose Maria de Areilza, County Motrcio; 25 prints of Commander W.R. Anderson and the USS Nautilus; 3 prints of Generalissimo Franco and the Pres. of the Nuclear Energy Board at the opening of the Juan Vigon National Nuclear Energy Center; and 8 prints of Lodge and Vice-Adm. Charles Brown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 10 prints of Representative Donald Jackson's visit to Madrid; 1 print of Lodge with Brig. General Royal Reynolds, Jr., and Brig. Gen. C.A. Dahlen; and 3 prints of Vice Chief of Staff Gen. Curtis LeMay; 8 prints of Minister of Foreign Affairs Fernando Castiella.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 50 prints of the Barcelona International Samples Fair, 1958; 1 print of the Count of Motrico and William Smedberg, III; 2 prints of Thomas Dewart; 2 prints of the board of the American Embassy Personnel Association; and 7 prints of Lodge at the Caritas Mattress Program Ceremony.Includes 50 prints of the Barcelona International Samples Fair, 1958; 1 print of the Count of Motrico and William Smedberg, III; 2 prints of Thomas Dewart; 2 prints of the board of the American Embassy Personnel Association; and 7 prints of Lodge at the Caritas Mattress Program Ceremony.

did.unittitle: 75 prints portraying John D. Lodge and his activities,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 1 print of the National Federation of Republican Women; 2 prints of Lodge attending a Chowder and Marching Club meeting; 6 prints of Lodge's participation in the 1968 Presidential Campaign; and 1 print of William Rentschler.

did.unittitle: 228 prints portraying John D. Lodge during his Ambassadorship to Argentina,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes circa 30 prints of Sec. William Rogers' visit to Argentina; 4 prints of Lodge and Amb. Ernest Siracusa; 3 prints of Lodge and Alejandro Orfila; 6 prints of Robert Michel; 1 print of lodge and Nixon.

did.unittitle: 168 prints portraying John D. Lodge during his Ambassadorship to Argentina,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 1 print of William Dohery of the American Institute for Free Labor Development; 1 print of the Minister of Economics Dr. Jose Maria Dagnino Pastore, 1 print of Foreign Minister Juan B. Martin; 30 prints of Sec. of Trade Dr. Elvio Bardinelli; 9 prints of Lodge's Presentation of Credentials; and 7 prints of Lodge's Swearing-in-Ceremony.

did.unittitle: 92 prints portraying John D. Lodge during his activities,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 3 prints of Bob Hope; 5 prints of Amb. John Humes and Arthur Kaufman; 9 prints of the Eisenhower Foundation Award to Lodge; 1 print of Argentine Amb. to the U.S. Jorge Espil and Robert Hill; 2 prints of Alberto Herce Consul General of Spain; and 3 prints of Gerald Ford and his wife.

did.unittitle: 78 prints portraying John D. Lodge during his Ambassadorship to Switzerland,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 5 prints of Lodge's Swearing-in-Ceremony with Chief Justice Warren Burger; 1 print of Lodge in Pres. Reagan's office; 1 negative of Admiral Andrew; 2 prints of Lodge and Kenneth Davis; 5 prints of Lodge and Reagan; 1 print of Reagan and Bush; and 3 prints of Lodge with Herman Levy.

did.unittitle: 139 prints portraying John D. Lodge during his Ambassadorship to Switzerland,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 1 print of William Baldridge; 1 print of Governor John Connolly; 16 prints of Lodge's medals; 1 print of Charles Wick; 9 prints of the signing of the deed for the Chancery Building; 1 print of the Iraqi Amb. Riyadh Ali Ali-Azzawi; 3 prints of King Gustav and Queen Sylvia of Sweden; and 1 print of the Lodges with Vice President Bush.

did.unittitle: 64 prints portraying John D. Lodge during his Governorship of Connecticut,
91 prints portraying John D. Lodge during his Ambassadorship to Argentina,
Approximately 60 prints illustrating the christening of the USS Nautilus
Approximately 262 prints portraying John D. Lodge during his Governorship of Connecticut,
1 print of the Ukrainian Congress Committee of America,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Speeches and interviews relating to American politics and foreign relations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: J. D. Lodge performing ambassadorial functions in Argentina.
